results.title: Ah...we humans
results.brief_description: A non-narrated, animated cartoon with humorous sound effects, giving an understanding of how people react when confronted with behaviour patterns different from their own. Deals with a number of concepts related to groups and conflict: cultural awareness, beliefs and ignorance, scarce resources and the value of alliances. No other credits available.

results.title: The Power of listening
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the meaning and benefits of active listening, problems associated with being an effective listener, deterrents to good listening skills and specific techniques to improve listening abilities.

results.title: Stephanie
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Sandra Richardson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “I myself”.
The film gives insights into Stephanie’s strategy for coping with a physical handicap. Her attitude towards others with intellectual and physical handicaps is revealed in her interactions with her sister at home and with handicapped children who visit her school.

results.title: Shane
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Sandra Richardson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “I myself”.
Shane identifies himself as ‘dumb’. The film examines some of the perceptions his parents, siblings and peers hold about Shane by showing him at his school and at his home. The interactions in these two settings illustrate some causes and consequences of low self-esteem

results.title: Sean and Joel
results.creator_credit: Ian Monroe, Sandra Richardson, Ian Munro, Martyn Down, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “I myself”.
Sean and Joel realise that their father has left home for good. He has remarried and the boys have stayed with their single mother. Their feelings about their new situation are revealed as they learn to adjust to the aftermath of parental separation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Monroe, Sandra Richardson, Ian Munro, Martyn Down, Tom Manefield and Film Australia

results.title: Children's aggression: its origin and control (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Examines the basis for normal aggression in young children, and presents methods for effectively managing this behaviour. Laboratory demonstrations and filmed examples of children’s aggression illustrate its types and causes

results.title: Bike style
results.brief_description: Two couples discover the joys of a summer holiday travelling by bicycles through Yugoslavia. The challenge of the trip, the opportunity of meeting people and the personal satisfaction are highlighted.

results.title: Fitness for sport
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sports training film series”.
This film shows how to attain the basic physical fitness which all sportsmen need for success - whatever their sport. More than fifty exercises are demonstrated and a squad of athletes is taken through a training session devised by a former Polish Olympic athlete to develop mobility, elastic strength and endurance. Written and narrated by Ron Pickering.

results.title: Having twins
results.brief_description: Focuses on the experiences of several couples who have experienced the joys and problems associated with having twins. Includes comments by an obstetrician who explains the reasons why complications often attend the birth of twins, as well as footage showing an actual multiple birth.
results.description: Focuses on the experiences of several couples who have experienced the joys and problems associated with having twins. results.title: The Mysteries of Hieronymus Bosch
results.creator_credit: Anne James and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: The extraordinary paintings of Hieronymus Bosch, painted over 400 years ago, continue to haunt and disturb us to such an extent that there is constant argument about their meaning. Dr Nicholas Baum presents an unusual detective story as he tries to unravel the mysteries of the man about whom so little is known.
